publictruefalseAttempts to link an already-existing SNOW or Armis record to a record on the other table.falselink_attemptlink_v21[{"name":"{{action.armis_device_record}}","label":"action➛armis_device_record","type":"action","ref":""},{"name":"{{action.type}}","label":"action➛type","type":"action","ref":""},{"name":"{{action.armis_record}}","label":"action➛armis_record","type":"action","ref":""},{"name":"{{action.snow_record}}","label":"action➛snow_record","type":"action","ref":""},{"name":"{{step[27a9e0a1-64ab-4623-8d95-0a5a1c4a0662].variable}}","label":"step➛Script step➛variable","type":"step","ref":""},{"name":"{{step[27a9e0a1-64ab-4623-8d95-0a5a1c4a0662].debug}}","label":"step➛Script step➛debug","type":"step","ref":""},{"name":"{{step[27a9e0a1-64ab-4623-8d95-0a5a1c4a0662].success}}","label":"step➛Script step➛success","type":"step","ref":""}](OLD) LINK_AttemptInitialLinkdraftsys_hub_action_type_definition32445782020-07-23 18:03:36falseglobal522ef53f1b0ed8104ca7edf9bc4bcb0f9(OLD) LINK_AttemptInitialLink7574b5e3dbf4d050cb24431e13961986false7574b5e3dbf4d050cb24431e13961986sys_hub_action_type_definition_522ef53f1b0ed8104ca7edf9bc4bcb0f32445782020-07-30 21:00:40false522ef53f1b0ed8104ca7edf9bc4bcb0f27a9e0a1-64ab-4623-8d95-0a5a1c4a06621

It does not make any API calls--it only checks the existing tables. If a link is successful, it will be recorded under "Linked SNOW Computer" under the Armis NEW RULES (per Jason Stanford): SNOW to Armis: 1. If the a NAME and MODEL match is found, and at least one SNOW MAC matches the Armis device's MAC, it's a golden match. 2. Assess all of the MACs associated with a device. a. Discard any MACs that appear in Network Adapters a number of times greater than the vmac_threshold b. Weight the MACs: i. Gets 1000 points if the IP associated is a 10.x.x.x ii. Gets 900 points if the adapter's name starts with "Local Area" iii. Loses 10 points for each time the MAC shows up in the network devices table. Armis to SNOW: 1. If the a NAME and MODEL match is found, and at least one SNOW MAC matches the Armis device's MAC, it's a golden match. (No additional attempts are made to match against the computers table.) */ //FUNCTION LIBRARY (v0.3) -- THESE FUNCTIONS HAVE BEEN MINIFIED. //FOR FULL DOCUMENTAITON AND A CURRENT COPY, SEE THE ACTION GlideDateTime).getNumericValue()-t,a} (function execute(inputs, outputs) { /*SNOW to Armis: 1. If the a NAME and MODEL match is found, and at least one SNOW MAC matches the Armis device's MAC, it's a golden match. 2. Assess all of the MACs associated with a device. a. Discard any MACs that appear in Network Adapters a number of times greater than the vmac_threshold b. Weight the MACs: i. Gets 1000 points if the IP associated is a 10.x.x.x ii. If the a NAME and MODEL match is found, and at least one SNOW MAC matches the Armis device's MAC, it's a golden match. 2. Assess all of the MACs associated with a device. a. Discard any MACs that appear in Network Adapters a number of times greater than the vmac_threshold b. Weight the MACs: i. Gets 1000 points if the IP associated is a 10.x.x.x ii. Gets 900 points if the adapter's name starts with "Local Area" iii. Loses 10 points for each time the MAC shows up in the network devices table. Armis to SNOW: 1. If the a NAME and MODEL match is found, and at least one SNOW MAC matches the Armis device's MAC, it's a golden match.
